result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dorsey Dakota Beeman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Dorsey Dakota Beeman.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 3, 4, and 5.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1,2, and 6 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant REMANDED. 

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
State's 1st Supplemental Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Dorsey Dakota Beeman.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.   Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bond

Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman in court, appear by video with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn, appear by video.  Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice to case 16CF789. Sworn for the State: MPD Pffocer E. Sneed.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court (as a friend of the court), defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for State vs Lee hearing. Atty Kuehn advised the public defender's office that she will take the case. Court finds good cause for extending time limits for prelim as stated on the record. Case adjourned in prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman not in court, defendant in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  GPS Bracelet and Bail Reduction.  (Dorsey D. Beeman - #2022003884, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BR 17 FOR BR 4:  Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman in court with attorney ON CALL attorney, Ashley Fard.  Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman in custody.  Daniel T. Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At this time, both the State and Defense counsel are content with the amount of bail previously set.   Court did order an additional condition of bail:  A GEOGRAPHICAL No Contact Order:  Within the Geographic area bordered by W. Keefe Ave. on the north; 9th Street on the east; Burleigh St. on the South and Teutonia Ave on the west.  Case remains calendared for preliminary hearing.  mn
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Signed and filed, No Contact/Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.T.H., R.A.B., and S.S.H.

Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Dorsey Dakota Beeman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dorsey Dakota Beeman appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).    Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 2.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
